title.value: A stochastic integer programming approach to reserve staff scheduling with preferences
title.quote: A stochastic integer programming approach to reserve staff scheduling with preferences

extractions.description: The paper addresses a variant of the personnel scheduling problem under unknown demand, incorporating employee satisfaction/preferences. It introduces a two-stage stochastic integer program with mixed-integer recourse to handle the endogenous and exogenous uncertainties in reserve staff scheduling. The approach is validated with empirical data from Los Angeles, showing improvements in social welfare and reductions in service cancellations.

type.justification: The paper focuses on the development and mathematical formulation of a two-stage stochastic integer program for staff scheduling, rather than conducting empirical experiments.
type.quote: To handle the challenges... we formulate this problem as a two-stage stochastic integer program with mixed-integer recourse.

name.justification: The paper deals with optimizing scheduling problems under uncertainty, a core topic in operations research.
name.quote: We tackle a new variant of the personnel scheduling problem under unknown demand... We address this problem in the context of reserve staff scheduling, an unstudied operational problem from the transit industry.

name.justification: The focus of the paper is on the scheduling of reserve staff to maximize employee satisfaction and cover absenteeism efficiently.
name.quote: First, we formulate a two-stage stochastic integer program with mixed-integer recourse to model the XB days-off scheduling problem over a finite time horizon.

name.justification: The problem is addressed using a two-stage stochastic programming approach to handle the uncertainties.
name.quote: To handle the challenges brought by the two uncertainty sources, regular employee and reserve employee absences, we formulate this problem as a two-stage stochastic integer program with mixed-integer recourse.

name.justification: The empirical study was conducted using data from the city of Los Angeles to validate the proposed approach.
name.quote: Our approach is validated with an empirical study based on data from the city of Los Angeles.
